result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany K Durrant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
matter set for plea/sent 12/9/22 at 8:30

10:00 a.m.  Defendant Brittany K Durrant in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brittany K Durrant. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Pfeil states the appearances.
No victim rights issues to address.
ADA Pfeil states that a new judge has been assigned per the request of the defendant and this is now a Branch 1 case.
Atty Soule and her client do not object to Branch 2 Judge hearing the arraignment today as the notice had been mailed prior to the reassignment of the case.
Motion to Dismiss issue with regards to the repeater is no longer an issue.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

FTR:  10:04:23 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Judge Michael D Zell assigned

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge filed by Atty Taylor Soule

3:10 PM Defendant Brittany K Durrant appeared by telephone.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brittany K Durrant.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is waiving her right to a personal appearance.
Defendant wishes to proceed remotely.

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving her rights to appear in person.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Atty Soule makes statements that the repeater enhancer has been removed from the charge.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss Repeater Enhancer filed by Atty Taylor Soule (Sent to Br 2 Judge/JA on 08/23/22 sp)

2:03 PM Defendant Brittany K Durrant in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brittany K Durrant.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:03 PM Defendant Brittany K Durrant not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brittany K Durrant. 

Defendant fails to appear.
Atty Soule states that her client's car had broken down and does not appear today and would request an adjournment.

BY THE COURT:
Case is adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brittany K Durrant in court. 

Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.
State provides a copy of the complaint to the defendant. 
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

Court advises defendant her rights include the right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant is eligible for counsel. 

BY THE COURT:  Court adjourns. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Initial Appearance set for July 5, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 2

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:01 PM Defendant Brittany K Durrant appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler in court for State of WI.  Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule is present in Court.
ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine and Paraphernalia. 
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on July 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
